intro: Brownanthus vaginatus subsp. schenckii, commonly known as the Schenck's brownanthus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub-like plant characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying shades of yellow to brown. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
